title: Emile Hemmen
text:
Emile Hemmen (6 December 1923 – 8 January 2021) was a <a href="Lyric%20poetry">lyric poet</a> and writer from Luxembourg who lived in <a href="Mondorf-les-Bains">Mondorf-les-Bains</a>.
Biography.
Hemmen was born in <a href="Sandweiler">Sandweiler</a> in December 1923. In his youth he refused to do military service for the German national socialist occupants and joined the <a href="Resistance%20during%20World%20War%20II">resistance</a> LPL "<a href="Luxembourgish%20Patriot%20League">Lëtzebuerger Patrioteliga</a>".
From 1945 to 1958 he worked as a teacher. Then he studied in Paris, specializing in psychology and sociology. He worked as an attaché for the <a href="Luxembourg">Luxembourg</a> Ministry of Education from 1968 to 1969.
Hemmen published over 40 works in French, German and <a href="Luxembourgish%20language">Luxembourgish</a>: a novel, short stories and numerous volumes of poetry. His work has been translated into several languages.es. He also contributed to many anthologies and <a href="literary%20magazine">literary magazine</a>s. Besides, he is one of the founders of "<a href="%C3%89ditions%20Estuaires">Éditions Estuaires</a>", one of the most important cultural magazines in the <a href="Luxembourg">Grand Duchy of Luxembourg</a>.
He died on 8 January, 2021 at the age of 97.
